snippet.title: Three dead in horror weekend on our roads
snippet.content: IT was a horror weekend on Victorian roads with three separate fatalities, all from cars veering off the road and hitting trees. The most recent happened at Dandenong North around 5.15am this morning when a car travelling south on Gladstone Rd left the road and struck a tree. The male driver, who is yet to be identified, died at the scene. Police are also investigating another crash on Briagolong Rd in Stratford around 8.30pm last night when a car veered off the road and struck trees. The third fatality happened in Morwell yesterday afternoon when a car left Princes Drive and struck a tree around 3.30pm. The male driver is yet to be identified and died at the scene. The exact cause of all three crashes are yet to be determined. The road toll for 2017 now sits at 148, compared to 176 this time last year.
